product_description.product_definition: Portland cement is defined as a hydraulic cement produced by pulverizing clinker, consisting essentially of crystalline hydraulic calcium silicates, and usually containing one or more of the following: water, calcium sulfate, up to 5% limestone, and processing additions.

types.description: For use when the special properties specified for any other type are not required.
For general use, more especially when moderate sulfate resistance is desired.
A Portland-limestone cement with limestone content more than 5% but less than or equal to 15% by mass.
A Portland-pozzolan cement with pozzolan constituent up to 40% by mass.

lca_information.cut_off_criteria: All input/output data required were collected and included in the LCI modelling. No substances with hazardous and toxic properties that pose a concern for human health and/or the environment were identified.
lca_information.data_collection: Gate-to-gate input/output flow data were collected for limestone quarry, clinker production and cement manufacture for the reference year 2019.
lca_information.allocation_rules: Recycling and recycled content are modeled using the cut-off rule.

data_quality_requirements.completeness: All relevant, specific processes were considered and modeled.
data_quality_requirements.transparency: Activity and LCI datasets are disclosed in the project report.

additional_info.sustainability_commitment: The Portland plant co-processes waste by recovering energy from scrap tires to replace some of the fossil fuels and mineral resources used in cement processing.
additional_info.environmental_protection: Holcim (US) manufacturing facilities comply with the U.S. environmental protection agency (EPA) regulations, monitor and report the emissions to air during the manufacturing process.
